UI_visible_response: Read 45 web pagesView Page DetailsThere are two individuals named Zhou Daiyu based on the search results:Zhou Daiyu in Petroleum Engineering:Zhou Daiyu is a researcher in the field of petroleum engineering. He has co-authored several papers on topics such as the effective storage capacity of abnormally high-pressure water-bearing condensate gas reservoirs and a new method for calculating oil and gas upwelling velocity. His work focuses on improving the understanding and management of petroleum reservoirs and related engineering processes.Zhou Daiyu in Computer Science:Zhou Daiyu is an assistant professor in the School of Computer Science at Peking University. He obtained his Ph.D. in computer science from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in 2020, advised by Prof. Yuval Tamir. His research interests include operating systems, storage systems, formal verification, dependable computing, concurrency, software/hardware co-design, and systems for machine learning.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: There are two individuals named Zhou Daiyu based on the search results:1. **Zhou Daiyu in Petroleum Engineering**:   - Zhou Daiyu is a researcher in the field of petroleum engineering. He has co-authored several papers on topics such as the effective storage capacity of abnormally high-pressure water-bearing condensate gas reservoirs[^6^] and a new method for calculating oil and gas upwelling velocity[^7^]. His work focuses on improving the understanding and management of petroleum reservoirs and related engineering processes.2. **Zhou Daiyu in Computer Science**:   - Zhou Daiyu is an assistant professor in the School of Computer Science at Peking University[^1^]. He obtained his Ph.D. in computer science from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in 2020, advised by Prof. Yuval Tamir. His research interests include operating systems, storage systems, formal verification, dependable computing, concurrency, software/hardware co-design, and systems for machine learning[^1^].
